{"step_by_step_thinking": "A face bow transfer record is a procedure used to record the spatial relationship of the maxillary arch to some anatomic reference point or points and then transfer this relationship to an articulator. It does not require the determination of the physiologic rest position, inclination of each condyle, or axial centre of rotation of condyle. However, it does require the determination of the kinematic axis of movement of the condyle, which is the hinge axis around which the mandible rotates within the temporomandibular joint.", "answer_choice": "D"}
